titleStmt.title: The pleasant history of Cawwood the rooke. Or, The assembly of birds with the severall speeches which the birds made to the eagle, in hope to have the government in his absence: and lastly, how the rooke was banished; with the reason why crafty fellowes are called rookes. As also fit morralls and expositions added to every chapter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. C[otes] for F. Grove, and are to be sold at his shoppe, at the upper end of Snow-Hill, neere the Sarazens head without Nevv-Gate,

notesStmt.note: Running title reads: The history of Cawwood the rooke.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: his shoppe, at the upper end of Snow-Hill, neere the Sarazens head without Nevv-Gate
